item.title: Microsoft launches consumer version of Copilot for US$20 a month with access to ChatGPT technology through Office
item.description:
English Summary:

Microsoft's Copilot Pro, a consumer version of its AI assistant, allows individuals to use OpenAI's latest ChatGPT and image-creation features for a monthly fee of $20. It integrates with Microsoft Office applications like Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint, enabling users to ask questions, summarize data, and create content. Previously available only to businesses with a minimum of 300 subscriptions, Microsoft is now making Copilot accessible to smaller companies and individuals.
  • Abstract: Microsoft debuts a consumer-friendly version of its Copilot AI assistant, integrated with Office applications and accessible to smaller businesses.
  • Theme: Expanding access to AI assistance for individuals and small companies, enhancing productivity and creativity through ChatGPT integration.
  • Viewpoint: Microsoft sees strong demand for AI-powered tools and aims to attract new paying customers with Copilot Pro.
  • Main information: Copilot Pro's features, pricing, integration with Office, availability to smaller companies and individuals, and data collection policies.

中文总结：

微软推出了面向消费者的 Copilot Pro，这是一款人工智能助手，允许个人以每月 20 美元的价格使用 OpenAI 最新的 ChatGPT 和图像创建功能。它与 Microsoft Office 应用程序（如 Word、Outlook、Excel 和 PowerPoint）集成，使用户能够提问、总结数据和创建内容。之前仅限于拥有至少 300 个订阅的企业使用，现在微软使 Copilot 可以供小型企业和个人使用。
  • 摘要：微软推出了面向消费者的 Copilot 人工智能助理，该助理与 Office 应用程序集成，小型企业也可以使用。
  • 主题：为个人和小企业扩展对人工智能辅助工具的访问权限，通过 ChatGPT 集成来提高生产力和创造力。
  • 观点：微软看到了对人工智能驱动的工具的强烈需求并希望通过 Copilot Pro 来吸引新的付费客户。
  • 主要信息：Copilot Pro 的功能、价格、与 Office 的集成、面向小型企业和个人的可用性以及数据收集政策。

单词：

  • consumer (n.) - /ˈkɑːnsjuːmər/ 消费者。

    原文例句：Consumers of Office will be able to use Copilot Pro to help answer questions and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于动词consume（消费），表示“消费者”。在这个例句中，它指的是Office的消费者，即使用Office的人。

  • assistant (n.) - /əˈsɪstənt/ 助理，助手。

    原文例句：Microsoft is opening up its artificial intelligence assistant to consumers...

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于动词assist（帮助），表示“助理，助手”。在这个例句中，它指的是微软的人工智能助手。

  • integrate (v.) - /ˈɪntɪɡreɪt/ 整合，集成。

    原文例句：Copilot Pro offers similar features to OpenAI’s ChatGPT Plus at the same price, though the integration with Office differentiates their product, Spataro said.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语integrare（使完整），表示“整合，集成”。在这个例句中，它指的是Copilot Pro与Office的整合。

词组：

  • artificial intelligence tool - 人工智能工具。

    原文例句：Microsoft is opening up its artificial intelligence assistant to consumers and making the corporate version available to smaller companies as it tries to increase the number of paying customers for the new services.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由artificial intelligence（人工智能）和tool（工具）构成的，表示“人工智能工具”。在这个例句中，它指的是微软的人工智能助手。

句子：

  • The company, which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user, will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service. - 这家公司一直在以每月每用户 30 美元的费用向大型企业销售类似产品，现在将取消其企业服务的 300 订阅最低限制。

    • 句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The company will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service，其中主语是The company，谓语是will get rid of，宾语是the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service。which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user是一个现在完成进行时态的非限定性定语从句，修饰The company，表示这家公司一直在以每月每用户 30 美元的费用向大型企业销售类似产品。

语法：

  • 现在完成进行时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The company, which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user, will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示这家公司从过去的某个时间开始一直在以每月每用户 30 美元的费用向大型企业销售类似产品，直到现在仍在进行。

  • Consumers of Office will be able to use Copilot Pro to help answer questions and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Companies previously had to buy at least 300 subscriptions to use Copilot, a requirement Microsoft is getting rid of

Microsoft is opening up its artificial intelligence assistant to consumers and making the corporate version available to smaller companies as it tries to increase the number of paying customers for the new services.

Microsoft is selling a US$20-a-month consumer version of Copilot, with access to OpenAI’s latest ChatGPT technology and image-creation features, the Redmond, Washington-based software giant said in a statement.

Consumers with a cloud subscription to Office will be able to use Copilot to help answer questions, summarise data and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.

The company, which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user, will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service.

As Microsoft has revamped nearly all of its products around artificial intelligence tools based on technology from OpenAI, its Office products remain one of the best ways to get customers to pay extra for AI assistance.

Executives have said demand is unusually high, with Azure chief Scott Guthrie likening it to the queues outside shops to purchase Windows 95 software nearly three decades ago.

Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot, now called Copilot for Microsoft 365, since March. The company began selling it widely in November, as long as companies purchased at least 300 subscriptions. That left out small businesses and those that wanted to begin with a smaller trial, said Jared Spataro, a Microsoft vice-president, in an interview.

“We have just never seen demand in the commercial space for a product like we are seeing for Copilot from Microsoft 365,’’ he said. “We have had pressure I have never seen from small and medium businesses saying ‘why will you not let us buy this? Let us try it’.”

Microsoft announced the new services ahead of the World Economic Forum in Davos, which will be attended by chief executive officer Satya Nadella.

Microsoft’s consumer service, called Copilot Pro, offers similar features to OpenAI’s ChatGPT Plus at the same price, though the integration with Office differentiates their product, Spataro said.

The company plans to roll out a builder tool, similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year, that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises.

Microsoft’s privacy rules for the consumer version also differ from the business one. Unlike data from corporate customers, Microsoft said it will retain a portion of prompts and responses from the consumer model to retrain models and improve the product.

item.title: AirPods maker Goertek to open Vietnam factory as part of Apple’s supply chain diversification
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese electronics manufacturer Goertek is investing $280 million to set up a subsidiary in Vietnam, focusing on consumer electronics, VR, and AR gear. This move aligns with Apple's strategy to diversify production outside China and capitalize on local resources to enhance competitiveness.
  • Abstract: Goertek expands into Vietnam to meet Apple's demand and reduce reliance on China.
  • Theme: Goertek's subsidiary in Vietnam aims to fulfill Apple's requirements for mixed reality and other products.
  • Viewpoint: Apple's shift away from China and the impact of stringent Covid-19 restrictions on supply chain.
  • Main information: Investment details, product focus, location in Bac Ninh province, alignment with Goertek's development plan.

总结：

中国电子制造商歌尔股份投资2.8亿美元在越南设立子公司，专注于消费电子、VR和AR设备。此举符合苹果将生产多元化至中国以外的战略，并利用当地资源提高竞争力。
  • 摘要：歌尔股份进军越南以满足苹果的需求并减少对中国的依赖。
  • 主题：歌尔股份在越南的子公司旨在满足苹果对混合现实和其他产品的需求。
  • 观点：苹果脱离中国的行动以及严格的 Covid-19 限制对供应链的影响。
  • 主要信息：投资细节、产品重点、位于北宁省、与歌尔股份的发展计划一致。

单词：

  • subsidiary (n.) - /səbˈsɪdɪəri/ 子公司，附属公司。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary, which will be set up through its Hong Kong entity Goertek (Hong Kong) Co, is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province.

    例句讲解：这个单词是sub（在……之下）和sidium（坐，坐下）构成的，表示“坐落在……之下，附属，子公司”。在这个例句中，它指的是歌尔股份通过其香港实体歌尔（香港）有限公司设立的越南子公司。

  • competitiveness (n.) - /kəmˌpe təˈtɪv nəs/ 竞争力。

    原文例句：“[The project] is advantageous to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness,” Goertek said.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由compete（竞争）和-tive（形容词后缀）构成的，表示“具有竞争力，竞争力”。在这个例句中，歌尔股份表示该项目有利于更好利用越南的本地资源，增强公司的整体竞争力。

词组：

  • set up - 建立，设立。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary, which will be set up through its Hong Kong entity Goertek (Hong Kong) Co, is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由set（设置，设立）和up（竖立，上升）构成的，表示“建立，设立，成立”。在这个例句中，它表示歌尔股份通过其香港实体歌尔（香港）有限公司设立的越南子公司。

句子：

  • “The project is advantageous to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness,” Goertek said. - “这个项目有利于更好地利用越南的本地资源来提高公司的整体竞争力，”歌尔股份说。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The project is advantageous to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness，其中主语是The project，谓语是is advantageous，宾语是to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness。子句Goertek said是一个现在时态的陈述句，作为主句的补充说明。这个句子的意思是说，歌尔股份表示这个项目有利于更好地利用越南的本地资源来提高公司的整体竞争力。

语法：

  • 不定式短语 - 由不定式及其宾语、状语构成的短语，作定语、状语、表语等。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms.

    语法讲解：这是一个不定式短语，由不定式to be located和宾语in the Bac Ninh province构成，作定语，修饰子句The Vietnamese subsidiary，表示越南子公司预计将位于北宁省。其中，不定式to be located是动词be的不定式形式，表示“位于，处在”。

  • 虚拟语气 - 在从句中用以表达虚拟、假设、愿望、建议等意义的语态。

    原文例句：The company has been tapped by Apple to become one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed reality Vision Pro headset, which is set to launch in early February.

    语法讲解：这是一个虚拟语气的句子，从句which is set to launch in early February是对主句The company has been tapped by Apple to become one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed reality Vision Pro headset的补充说明，表示混合现实Vision Pro头显预计将于2月初发布。虚拟语气的使用表明这是一个虚拟或假设的情况，即混合现实Vision Pro头显可能或将要发布，但尚未确定。

  • Goertek was tapped by Apple as one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed reality Vision Pro headset, which is set to launch in early February
  • The Vietnamese subsidiary is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms

Apple supplier Goertek said on Monday it would invest up to US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam to meet demands for “business expansion and long-term operation” in the Southeast Asian nation, according to a corporate filing.

Goertek’s Vietnamese entity, which will manufacture consumer electronics products from AirPods and smartwatches to virtual reality and augmented reality gear, is a project that will meet both the Chinese assembler’s future development plan and client demand, it said in the filing to the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.

“[The project] is advantageous to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness,” Goertek said.

Goertek has been tapped by Apple to become one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed reality Vision Pro headset, which is set to launch in early February.

Apple supplier BOE signs US$9 billion deal to build display plant in China

The Vietnamese subsidiary, which will be set up through its Hong Kong entity Goertek (Hong Kong) Co, is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms including consumer electronics and semiconductor giant Samsung Electronics.

South Korean firms have emerged as major investors in the Vietnamese province, setting up factories for electronics, smartphone, semiconductor and precision mechanical manufacturing, according to the Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

Goertek’s latest move comes as Apple is starting to shift more of its production outside China, a move that came after Beijing’s stringent Covid-19 restrictions during the pandemic disrupted Apple’s supply chain, impacting its global sales in the lead up to the Christmas shopping season in 2022.

JD.com supports Huawei’s HarmonyOS as alternative for Apple iOS, Android in China

Since then, Apple has encouraged its manufacturing partners to diversify into other countries, including Vietnam, to reduce its reliance on China.

Apple suppliers, including Taiwanese contract manufacturer Foxconn, have invested up to US$16 billion to reduce their dependence on China, by relocating facilities to India, Vietnam, Mexico as well as the US, according to a report by AppleInsider, citing research by investment bank TD Cowen.

Late last year, Foxconn, the biggest maker of iPhones, announced a plan to invest US$1.6 billion in India to expand its presence in the South Asian nation.

item.title: Apple’s China price cuts on iPhones, MacBooks ‘cancel out’ pressure from rivals chasing premium segment, say analysts
item.description:
English summary:

Apple offers Chinese consumers discounts of up to $113 on some of its products in response to increasing competition from local rivals, particularly Huawei. The discounts apply to a range of items, including iPhones, iPads, MacBook Airs, Apple Watches, and AirPods, and will be available until the end of the coming weekend. Apple hopes this sales promotion will boost revenue ahead of the Lunar New Year, which is a time of increased consumer spending in China.
  • Abstract: Apple offers discounts to boost sales in China amid competition.
  • Theme: Apple faces rising competition from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei, in the premium smartphone market.
  • Viewpoint: Apple's price cuts are a strategic move to counter competition and boost sales during the Lunar New Year.
  • Main information: Discount amounts for various products; timing of the promotion; Apple's declining market share in China.

中文总结：

苹果公司在中国推出优惠活动，为消费者提供高达 800 元的折扣，以应对来自本地竞争对手（尤其是华为）的日益激烈的竞争。此次促销活动涵盖 iPhone、iPad、MacBook Air 笔记本电脑、Apple Watch 和 AirPods 等产品，并将持续到本周末结束。苹果希望借助此轮促销活动在即将到来的农历新年（中国一年中最主要的节日）期间提振营收。市场咨询公司 Counterpoint Research 的高级分析师 Ivan Lam 表示，此次促销活动预计将推动苹果的营收增长，尤其是在农历新年期间。拉姆表示，苹果此次在中国降价的时机恰逢农历新年期间的消费高峰，“这一战略性价格调整将抵消竞争压力，还将提振销量增长，尤其是在农历新年期间。”此外，这一举措还有助于苹果清库存。拉姆认为，苹果正面临来自中国竞争对手（尤其是华为）日益增长的竞争压力，因为它们正在蚕食以加州库比蒂诺为基地的苹果公司曾经统治的高端智能手机市场份额。他指出，中国智能手机品牌在过去几个月推出了多款中高端设备，其中许多产品价格极具竞争优势，为 3999 元起，并且配备的功能可与价格更高的手机媲美。这些机型是中国厂商争夺高端智能手机市场的努力成果，正在对苹果较早的 iPhone 机型以及其新 iPhone 15 系列的基本版本构成挑战。根据股票研究公司 Jefferies 的数据，2023 年 iPhone 在中国大陆的总销量同比下降 3%，导致苹果的市场份额下降 0.4%。Jefferies 估计，华为在 12 月份的季度中，其在大中华区的市场份额较上一季度增长了 2%，同比增长了 6%。
  • 摘要：苹果公司为提振销量在华提供折扣以应对竞争。
  • 主题：苹果公司在高端智能手机市场面临来自中国竞争对手，尤其是华为的日益增长的竞争。
  • 观点：苹果降价是应对竞争和在农历新年期间提振销量的战略举措。
  • 主要信息：不同产品的折扣金额；促销活动的时间；苹果在中国下滑的市场份额。

单词：

  • rival (n.) - /ˈraɪvəl/ 对手，竞争者。

    原文例句：Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei.

    例句讲解：“rival”意为“对手，竞争者”，指与某人或某物竞争的人或事物。它通常用于描述在某一领域或方面相互竞争的个人、团队或企业。在这个句子中，“rival”指的是苹果公司在中国面临来自中国竞争对手，尤其是华为的日益增长的竞争压力。

  • premium (adj.) - /ˈpriːmiəm/ 优质的，高级的。

    原文例句：They inch towards the premium smartphone segment once ruled over by the Cupertino, California-based company.

    例句讲解：“premium”意为“优质的，高级的”，指质量、性能或价格高于普通水平的。它通常用于描述高档或豪华的产品或服务。在这个句子中，“premium”指的是中国智能手机品牌正在逐渐蚕食以加州库比蒂诺为基地的苹果公司曾经统治的高端智能手机市场份额。

  • compete (v.) - /kəmˈpiːt/ 竞争，参与竞争。

    原文例句：Chinese smartphone brands have rolled out a series of middle to high-end devices over the last few months, many of which are competitively priced from 3,999 yuan.

    例句讲解：“compete”意为“竞争，参与竞争”，指在某一领域或方面与他人或其他事物进行竞争。它通常用于描述为获得优势或胜利而进行的努力。在这个句子中，“compete”指的是中国智能手机品牌推出了多款中高端设备，其中许多产品价格极具竞争优势，为 3999 元起。

词组：

  • in response to - 为了应对。

    原文例句：Apple offers Chinese consumers discounts of up to $113 on some of its products in response to increasing competition from local rivals.

    例句讲解：“in response to”意为“为了应对”，指为了回应或解决某个情况或问题而采取的行动。它通常用于描述对某一事件、情况或趋势的反应。在这个句子中，“in response to”指的是苹果公司为了应对来自本地竞争对手（尤其是华为）的日益激烈的竞争，推出优惠活动，为消费者提供高达 800 元的折扣。

句子：

  • Chinese smartphone brands have rolled out a series of middle to high-end devices over the last few months, many of which are competitively priced from 3,999 yuan. - 中国智能手机品牌在过去几个月推出了多款中高端设备，其中许多产品价格极具竞争优势，为 3999 元起。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Chinese smartphone brands have rolled out a series of middle to high-end devices，其中主语是Chinese smartphone brands，谓语是have rolled out，宾语是a series of middle to high-end devices。many of which are competitively priced from 3,999 yuan是一个非限制性定语从句，修饰先行词a series of middle to high-end devices，表示其中许多产品价格极具竞争优势，为 3999 元起。这个句子的意思是说，中国智能手机品牌在过去几个月推出了多款中高端设备，其中许多产品价格极具竞争优势，为 3999 元起。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei.

    语法讲解：现在完成时态是由have/has + been + 现在分词构成的，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。它通常用于描述持续了一段时间的动作或状态，或者描述一个已经完成但其结果或影响仍然存在的状态。在这个句子中，现在完成时态表示苹果公司一直面临来自中国竞争对手，尤其是华为的日益增长的竞争压力。

  • Consumers can receive up to 500 yuan off from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version, while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan
  • Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei, as they inch towards the premium smartphone segment

US consumer electronics giant Apple is offering Chinese consumers discounts of up to 800 yuan (US$113) on a range of products, from iPhones to MacBooks, in a move to fend off intensifying competition from local rivals such as Huawei Technologies ahead of the Lunar New Year.

In a sales promotion covering iPhones, iPads, MacBook Air laptops, the Apple Watch and AirPods, which will run until the end of the coming weekend, consumers can receive up to 500 yuan off from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version, while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan, according to the firm’s mainland China website.

The sale, coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people, is expected to boost revenue for Apple amid increasing competition from local players, according to Ivan Lam, senior analyst at market consultancy Counterpoint Research.

Apple to launch classical music app in China amid weak iPhone sales

Lam said the timing of Apple’s price cuts in China would take advantage of the typical consumer spending surge around the Lunar New Year.

“The strategic price adjustment will cancel out competitive pressure but will also boost sales growth, especially around the Lunar New Year season,” Lam said in a research note on Monday, adding that the move will also help Apple clear out older models from its inventory.

Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei, as they inch towards the premium smartphone segment once ruled over by the Cupertino, California-based company, according to Lam.

Chinese smartphone brands have rolled out a series of middle to high-end devices over the last few months, many of which are competitively priced from 3,999 yuan, and equipped with functions that rival higher-priced phones, he noted.

Foxconn pushes into car production near its biggest iPhone plant

These models, representing efforts made by Chinese vendors to vie for the premium smartphone segment, are posing challenges to Apple’s older iPhone models as well as the basic versions of its new iPhone 15 line.

Total 2023 sales volume for the iPhone in mainland China dropped 3 per cent year on year, which translated to a 0.4 per cent decline in Apple’s market share, according to equity research firm Jefferies.

Jefferies estimated that Huawei saw its mainland market share in the December quarter gain 2 per cent from the previous quarter, and 6 per cent year on year.

item.title: Internet titans bury the hatchet as Tencent allows Douyin to air Honour of Kings videos amid ByteDance retreat
item.description:
Summary：

Tencent and ByteDance, two Chinese tech giants, have ended their years-long feud over video game streaming rights. Honour of Kings, Tencent's blockbuster game, will return to ByteDance's Douyin platform after ByteDance exits the gaming sector. This move signals a potential partnership between the two companies, with Tencent emerging as a possible buyer of ByteDance's gaming operations.
  • Abstract: Tech giants Tencent and ByteDance resolve their dispute over video game streaming.
  • Theme: The end of a fierce rivalry between two major players in the Chinese tech industry.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of collaboration in the face of regulatory challenges and a difficult economic climate.
  • Main information: Honour of Kings' return to Douyin; potential acquisition of ByteDance's gaming business by Tencent; history of legal battles between the companies; recent thaw in relations and copyright cooperation agreement.

总结：

腾讯和字节跳动这两家中国科技巨头结束了长达数年的游戏视频版权纷争。腾讯旗下的热门游戏《王者荣耀》将在字节跳动放弃游戏业务后重新登陆字节跳动的抖音平台。此举标志着两家公司可能达成合作，腾讯有望成为字节跳动游戏业务的潜在买家。在监管挑战和艰难的经济形势下，这表明了合作的重要性。
  • 摘要：科技巨头腾讯和字节跳动解决了有关游戏视频流媒体的争端。
  • 主题：中国科技行业两大巨头之间的激烈竞争的终结。
  • 观点：在监管挑战和严峻的经济形势下，合作具有重要意义。
  • 主要信息：《王者荣耀》回归抖音；腾讯可能收购字节跳动的游戏业务；两家公司之间的历史法律纠纷；近期关系缓和与版权合作协议。

单词：

  • esports (n.) - /ˈiːspɔːrts/ 电子竞技。

    原文例句：Live-streaming sessions featuring Chinese esports team XYG began on Douyin on Sunday.

    例句讲解：这个单词是electronic（电子的）和sports（体育）的缩写，表示“电子竞技”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国电子竞技战队XYG在抖音上开始的直播。

  • plagiarize (v.) - /ˈpleɪdʒəraɪz/ 抄袭，剽窃。

    原文例句：Zhang accused Tencent of plagiarising Douyin and Ma fired back, calling the comment “slander”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由plagiarius（窃贼）和-ize（使……化）构成，表示“抄袭，剽窃”。在这个例句中，它表示张一鸣指责腾讯抄袭抖音，而马化腾回击，称此评论是“诽谤”。

词组：

  • fierce rivalry - 激烈的竞争。

    原文例句：Tencent and ByteDance, two Chinese tech giants, have ended their years-long fierce rivalry over video game streaming rights.

    例句讲解：这个词组由fierce（激烈的）和rivalry（竞争）组成，表示“激烈的竞争”。在这个例句中，它指的是腾讯和字节跳动这两家中国科技巨头在网络游戏视频流媒体版权方面多年的激烈竞争。

  • potential partnership - 潜在的合作。

    原文例句：This move signals a potential partnership between the two companies, with Tencent emerging as a possible buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations.

    例句讲解：这个词组由potential（潜在的）和partnership（合作伙伴关系）组成，表示“潜在的合作”。在这个例句中，它指的是此举表明两家公司之间存在潜在的合作，腾讯有望成为字节跳动游戏业务的潜在买家。

句子：

  • Honour of Kings, Tencent’s blockbuster game, will return to ByteDance’s short video app Douyin as the two internet giants bury the hatchet following the TikTok owner’s decision to exit the sector. - 随着TikTok所有者决定退出该领域，腾讯旗下热门游戏《王者荣耀》将回归字节跳动的短视频应用程序抖音，两家互联网巨头化干戈为玉帛。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Honour of Kings will return to ByteDance’s short video app Douyin，其中主语是Honour of Kings，谓语是will return，宾语是to ByteDance’s short video app Douyin。as the two internet giants bury the hatchet following the TikTok owner’s decision to exit the sector是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示这一消息的内容或方式，即随着TikTok所有者决定退出该领域，两家互联网巨头化干戈为玉帛。这个句子的意思是说，随着TikTok所有者决定退出该领域，两家互联网巨头化干戈为玉帛，腾讯旗下热门游戏《王者荣耀》将回归字节跳动的短视频应用程序抖音。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子的主语以外的人或事物引起的。

    原文例句：The game’s return to the ByteDance platform comes five years after a court in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province, banned the streaming of Honour of Kings on Xigua Video, another video streaming site run by the Douyin operator, in 2019.

    语法讲解：这个句子使用了被动语态，主语是game’s return，谓语是被动语态的现在完成时comes，其中be动词is用的是第三人称单数形式，过去分词come表示动作或状态的完成。在这个例句中，它表示游戏的回归到字节跳动的平台是在广州市法院于2019年禁止在西瓜视频（另一个由抖音运营商运营的视频流媒体网站）上播放《王者荣耀》五年后发生的。

  • 比较级和最高级 - 表示比较程度。

    原文例句：Tencent’s eight-year-old Honour of Kings, however, continues to lead as the world’s highest-grossing mobile game in November, according to data from Sensor Tower.

    语法讲解：这个句子使用了比较级和最高级，比较级是highest-grossing，最高级是world’s。比较级表示两个或多个事物中程度较高的一个，最高级表示所有事物中程度最高的一个。在这个例句中，它表示根据Sensor Tower的数据，腾讯已经运营了八年的《王者荣耀》继续保持着世界收入最高的手游地位。

  • Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese studios
  • ByteDance’s retreat from the mainstay of Tencent’s business is likely to bring the curtain down on a series of online spats

Honour of Kings, the blockbuster video game from market leader Tencent Holdings, will return to ByteDance’s short video app Douyin as the two internet giants bury the hatchet following the TikTok owner’s decision to exit the sector.

The Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese video game studios and court battles over copyright, but that has ceased with Tencent now seen as a potential buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations.

Honour of Kings, the world’s most popular mobile game, will be officially streamed on Douyin’s live-streaming platform from January 21, according to an announcement by the title’s official account on social media platform Weibo.

Before the official return, live-streaming sessions featuring Chinese esports team XYG began on Douyin on Sunday, and another three-day session with Zhang Daxian, a popular Honour of Kings streamer with over 50 million followers on the video platform, is slated to start on Thursday.

The game’s return to the ByteDance platform comes five years after a court in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province, banned the streaming of Honour of Kings on Xigua Video, another video streaming site run by the Douyin operator, in 2019.

The collaboration between ByteDance’s popular Chinese video app and Tencent’s biggest title comes amid regulatory uncertainties for the industry and a weaker macro environment in China. Tencent’s eight-year-old Honour of Kings, however, continues to lead as the world’s highest-grossing mobile game in November, according to data from Sensor Tower.

TikTok owner ByteDance has also confirmed it is in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, for its video game operations.

The retreat by ByteDance from the mainstay of Tencent’s business is likely to bring the curtain down on a series of online spats between the two billionaire founders of the respective companies, which saw a freeze in business dealings and dozens of lawsuits between them.

The feud started in 2018 with the rapid rise of Douyin, the Chinese sister app of TikTok, when Tencent boss Pony Ma Huateng and ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming engaged in rare online bickering. Zhang accused Tencent of plagiarising Douyin and Ma fired back, calling the comment “slander”.

ByteDance later sued the Shenzhen-based tech giant for anticompetitive behaviour and Tencent responded with a defamation lawsuit. Tencent also announced that it would halt all existing partnerships with ByteDance and its affiliated companies.

More legal battles followed in the next few years, as ByteDance accused Tencent of blocking links to Douyin in its flagship WeChat app. Tencent sued ByteDance for copyright infringement by streaming video and gaming content without authorisation.

However, there has been a growing thaw in icy relations in recent years.

In 2023 Tencent and Douyin ended their copyright disputes by signing a cooperation agreement on content distribution. Under the deal, Tencent will authorise Douyin to distribute its video content and it clarified copyright rules for users to produce modifications and adaptations.

Users of Douyin, Xigua Video and Jinri Toutiao, all operated by ByteDance, will also be able to produce derivative works based on Tencent-owned videos.

item.title: China EVs: CATL, world’s top battery maker, plans first plant in Beijing to supply Li Auto and Xiaomi
item.description:
English Summary：

CATL, the world's largest electric vehicle battery manufacturer, will build its first plant in Beijing to meet the growing demand for battery-powered cars in China. The plant will help Beijing establish a complete supply chain for EV production, serving key clients like Li Auto and Xiaomi. CATL's Shenxing battery, which offers a 400km driving range with just 10 minutes of charging, will be delivered by the end of the first quarter.
  • Abstract: CATL to build first plant in Beijing, targeting rising demand for battery-powered cars in China.
  • Theme: CATL's expansion in Beijing to support the growth of China's EV industry.
  • Viewpoint: Importance of local production lines for key suppliers like CATL to serve major clients.
  • Main information: Plant construction to start this year; Shenxing battery's fast-charging capabilities; Beijing's goal to establish a complete EV supply chain.

中文总结：

全球最大的电动汽车电池制造商宁德时代将在北京建设其第一家工厂，以满足中国不断增长的对电池动力汽车的需求。该工厂将帮助北京建立完整的电动汽车生产供应链，为李汽车和小米等主要客户提供服务。宁德时代的“神性”电池可以在短短 10 分钟的充电时间内提供 400 公里的续航里程，并凭借其所谓的 4C 充电功能在 15 分钟内达到 100% 的电量，预计将在第一季度末交付。
  • 摘要：宁德时代将在北京建设第一家工厂，瞄准中国对电池动力汽车不断增长的需求。
  • 主题：宁德时代在北京的扩张以支持中国电动汽车产业的增长。
  • 观点：对于像宁德时代这样的主要供应商来说，建立本地生产线以服务主要客户尤为重要。
  • 主要信息：工厂建设将于今年启动；神性电池的快速充电能力；北京的目标是建立完整的电动汽车供应链。

单词：

  • gigawatt-hour - /ˈɡɪɡəˌwɔːtˌaʊə/ 吉瓦时，相当于十亿瓦时。

    原文例句：The company, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023, is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由giga（十亿）和watt-hour（瓦时）构成的，表示十亿瓦时，是计量电能的单位。在这个例句中，它表示这家公司在2023年前11个月的电池产量为233.4吉瓦时，占全球市场的37.4%，预计将成为李汽车和小米的关键供应商，当该智能手机制造商的北京工厂投入运营时。

  • cutthroat - /ˈkʌtˌθrəʊt/ 激烈的，残酷的。

    原文例句：UBS analyst Paul Gong said last week that only 10 to 12 companies would survive the cutthroat mainland market by 2030, as intensifying competition has been piling pressure on the 200-plus Chinese EV makers.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由cut（割，切）和throat（喉咙）构成的，比喻竞争激烈，像割喉一样残酷。在这个例句中，它表示瑞银分析师保罗·龚上周表示，到2030年，只有10到12家公司将在激烈的中国大陆市场中存活下来，因为日益激烈的竞争给200多家中国电动汽车制造商带来了压力。

词组：

  • be set to do something - 准备做某事。

    原文例句：CATL is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由be set（设定，准备）和to do something（做某事）构成的，表示“准备做某事”。在这个例句中，它表示宁德时代预计将成为李汽车和小米的关键供应商，当该智能手机制造商的北京工厂投入运营时，这一消息是根据分析师的预测。

句子：

  • “So it is reasonable for key suppliers like CATL to establish local production lines to serve its major clients,” Cao said. - 曹先生说：“因此，像宁德时代这样的主要供应商在当地建立生产线为其主要客户提供服务是合理的。”

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是It is reasonable for key suppliers like CATL to establish local production lines to serve its major clients，其中主语是It，谓语是is reasonable，宾语是for key suppliers like CATL to establish local production lines to serve its major clients。So it is reasonable是一个状语从句，表示原因。在这个例句中，曹先生说，像宁德时代这样的主要供应商在当地建立生产线为其主要客户提供服务是合理的。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态，或者表示已经完成的动作或状态及其结果对现在造成的影响。

    原文例句：CATL’s plant will help China’s capital city form a complete supply-chain for EV production, as Li Auto, the country’s top electric-car start-up, and smartphone maker Xiaomi, both based in Beijing, step up the development of new models.

    语法讲解：现在完成时态是由have/has和过去分词构成的，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态，或者表示已经完成的动作或状态及其结果对现在造成的影响。在这个例句中，它表示宁德时代的工厂将帮助中国首都形成一个完整的电动汽车生产供应链，因为中国领先的电动汽车初创企业李汽车和总部位于北京的智能手机制造商小米正在加紧开发新车型。

  • CATL, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global battery market last year, will start construction on the Beijing plant this year, city’s economic planner says
  • Ningde-based firm plans to deliver its Shenxing battery, which can offer 400km of driving range with just 10 minutes of charging, before the end of the first quarter

Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL), the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) battery manufacturer, will build its first plant in Beijing to tap the rising demand for battery-powered cars in mainland China.

CATL’s plant will help China’s capital city form a complete supply-chain for EV production, as Li Auto, the country’s top electric-car start-up, and smartphone maker Xiaomi, both based in Beijing, step up the development of new models.

CATL, based in Ningde, eastern Fujian province, will begin construction on the plant this year, according to a statement by the Beijing Commission of Development and Reform, the city’s economic planning agency, which did not provide details about the plant’s capacity or launch date. CATL declined to comment.

The company, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023, is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts.

Li Auto is already a major player in China’s premium EV segment, and Xiaomi has the potential to become one, said Cao Hua, a partner at private-equity firm Unity Asset Management.

“So it is reasonable for key suppliers like CATL to establish local production lines to serve its major clients,” Cao said.

Beijing’s economic planning agency said that Li Auto is considering setting up a production base for car parts, without revealing details.

Li Auto is the closest rival to Tesla in China’s premium EV segment, delivering 376,030 intelligent vehicles to mainland buyers in 2023, a jump of 182.2 per cent year on year.

Tesla handed 603,664 units made at its Shanghai Gigafactory to Chinese customers last year, an increase of 37.3 per cent year on year.

Xiaomi unveiled its first model, SU7, at the end of 2023. Featuring a sleek look and a sports-car level of performance, the company plans to begin trial production of the electric sedan in the coming months.

CEO Lei Jun said Xiaomi will strive to become a top five global carmaker in the next 15 to 20 years.

In China, the EV penetration rate exceeded 40 per cent in late 2023 amid motorists’ rising penchant for environmentally friendly cars featuring autonomous driving technology and digital cockpits.

Mainland China is now the world’s largest automotive and EV market, with sales of battery-powered cars accounting for about 60 per cent of the global total.

UBS analyst Paul Gong said last week that only 10 to 12 companies would survive the cutthroat mainland market by 2030, as intensifying competition has been piling pressure on the 200-plus Chinese EV makers.

Sales of battery-powered vehicles on the mainland are expected to slow to 20 per cent this year, compared with 37 per cent growth recorded in 2023, according to a forecast by Fitch Ratings in November.

Meanwhile, CATL will start delivering the world’s fastest-charging electric-car battery before the end of the year’s first quarter, another technological breakthrough to speed up the use of battery-powered cars.

The Shenxing battery, which can offer 400 kilometres of driving range with just 10 minutes of charging and reach 100 per cent capacity in just 15 minutes as a result of the so-called 4C charging capabilities.

item.title: Why a Chinese court’s landmark decision recognising the copyright for an AI-generated image benefits creators in this nascent field
item.description:
English summary：

A Beijing court's decision to recognize the copyright of an image generated by artificial intelligence (AI) aims to encourage such creations and boost this nascent industry. The court ruled that the AI-generated image is an artwork under copyright protection due to the originality and intellectual input of its human creator. This decision is expected to serve as a reference for future disputes and promote the development of the generative AI industry in China.
  • Abstract: Beijing court recognizes the copyright of AI-generated images.
  • Theme: Legal status for generative AI content encourages creativity and supports emerging industries.
  • Viewpoint: The court's decision considers the intellectual input of the human creator and aims to stimulate the growth of the generative AI industry.
  • Main information: Case details, court ruling, presiding judge's comments, implications for emerging industries, and China's aspirations for generative AI.

中文总结：

北京互联网法院的一项判决承认人工智能（AI）生成的图像的版权，旨在鼓励这类创作并提振这个新兴行业。法院裁定，AI 生成的图像属于受版权法保护的艺术作品，因为其人类创造者的原创性和智力投入。此项判决有望为解决未来的争议提供参考，并促进中国生成式人工智能产业的发展。
  • 摘要：北京法院承认人工智能生成图像的版权。
  • 主题：赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位鼓励创造力并支持新兴产业。
  • 观点：法院的裁决考虑了人类创造者的智力投入，旨在刺激生成式人工智能产业的增长。
  • 主要信息：案件细节、法院裁决、主审法官的评论、对新兴产业的影响以及中国对生成式人工智能的展望。

单词：

  • nascent (adj.) - /ˈneɪs(ə)nt/ 新生的，刚刚兴起的。

    原文例句：The Beijing Internet Court last November ruled that a picture, generated via the text-to-image software Stable Diffusion, should be considered an artwork under the protection of copyright laws, because of the “originality” and intellectual input of its human creator.

    例句讲解：“Nascent”在此处表示“刚刚兴起的”，指的是人工智能（AI）生成的图像这个新兴领域。

  • implications (n.) - /ɪmplɪˈkeɪʃ(ə)nz/ 暗示，影响。

    原文例句：Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report.

    例句讲解：“Implications”在此处表示“影响”，指的是法院的判决对“新兴产业”的影响。

  • ramp up (phr. v.) - /ræmp ʌp/ 迅速增加，加紧。

    原文例句：Many Chinese tech firms have also ramped up their efforts to grow their businesses using generative AI.

    例句讲解：“Ramp up”在此处表示“加紧”，指的是许多中国科技公司加快了利用生成式人工智能发展业务的步伐。

词组：

  • legal status - 法律地位。

    原文例句：Assigning generative AI content a legal status under certain conditions in this case is aimed at encouraging people to create with new tools, presiding judge Zhu Ge said last week at a lecture that was first reported on Monday by Chinese online news outlet The Paper.

    例句讲解：“Legal status”在此处表示“法律地位”，指的是赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位。

句子：

  • The intellectual property infringement lawsuit was initiated in May last year by the plaintiff surnamed Li, who used the US start-up StabilityAI’s Stable Diffusion program to create an image of a young Asian woman and posted it on Chinese social media platform Xiaohongshu. - 知识产权侵权诉讼始于去年 5 月，原告姓李，他使用美国初创公司 StabilityAI 的 Stable Diffusion 程序创建了一个年轻亚洲女性的图像，并将其发布在中国社交媒体平台小红书上。
  • Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report. - 主审法官朱葛在她的演讲中表示，做出这项裁决时考虑到了对“新兴产业”的潜在影响，据 The Paper 报道。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report.

    语法讲解：句子中的“said”表示说话，现在完成时态表示说话这一动作发生在过去，并且其影响或结果一直持续到说话的时刻。在此句中，“said”这一动作发生在过去的演讲中，其影响或结果——裁决的做出——一直持续到演讲的时刻。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子的宾语承受的。

    原文例句：Beijing court rules AI-generated content covered by copyright, eschews US stand - 北京法院裁定人工智能生成的内容受版权保护，回避美国立场。

    语法讲解：句子中的“covered”表示覆盖，被动语态表示动作“covered”是由句子的宾语“content”承受的。在此句中，“content”这一宾语承受了“covered”这一动作，即人工智能生成的内容被版权保护。

  • Assigning generative AI content a legal status aims to encourage people to create with new tools, Beijing Internet Court judge Zhu Ge said
  • The court’s ruling last November has added fuel to heated arguments on whether AI-generated content should be protected by copyright laws

A Chinese court’s decision recognising the copyright of an image generated via artificial intelligence (AI) aims to encourage such creations and provide a boost to this nascent industry, according to the judge who made the landmark ruling.

In the first judgment of its kind in mainland China, the Beijing Internet Court last November ruled that a picture, generated via the text-to-image software Stable Diffusion, should be considered an artwork under the protection of copyright laws, because of the “originality” and intellectual input of its human creator.

Assigning generative AI content a legal status under certain conditions in this case is aimed at encouraging people to create with new tools, presiding judge Zhu Ge said last week at a lecture that was first reported on Monday by Chinese online news outlet The Paper.

“If no content created with AI models can be considered artwork, this would deal a blow to the industry,” Zhu was quoted as saying in the report.

Although the ruling has added fuel to heated arguments on whether AI-generated content should be protected by copyright laws, the Beijing Internet Court has asserted that future disputes about an author’s personal expression in images created with AI’s help should be judged on a case-by-case basis.

The intellectual property infringement lawsuit was initiated in May last year by the plaintiff surnamed Li, who used the US start-up StabilityAI’s Stable Diffusion program to create an image of a young Asian woman and posted it on Chinese social media platform Xiaohongshu.

Li sued a blogger surnamed Liu for allegedly using that image without permission in a post on Baijiahao, a Chinese content-sharing platform owned by Baidu.

The court subsequently ruled in favour of Li. It said Li’s AI-generated image was an artwork, based on how he had continuously added prompts and repeatedly adjusted the parameters to come up with a picture that reflected his “aesthetic choice and personalised judgment”.

Beijing court rules AI-generated content covered by copyright, eschews US stand

The court ordered the defendant Liu to issue a public apology as well as pay the plaintiff 500 yuan (US$70.43) in damages and 50 yuan for court fees.

Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report. It said Zhu hoped her decision in the case could serve as a reference for future disputes.

The court’s ruling has come as China’s aspirations for generative AI continue to evolve amid wider use of the technology around the world. Advances in the use of AI are also expected to transform industries and improve people’s daily lives.

China’s generative AI industry is forecast to contribute 30 trillion yuan worth of economic value by 2035, accounting for a third of the industry’s global value of 90 trillion yuan, according to a report by the CCID Group, a research unit affiliated with Ministry of Industry and Information Technology.

Many Chinese tech firms have also ramped up their efforts to grow their businesses using generative AI. Chinese delivery services giant Meituan, for example, recently launched Wow, a chatbot that purports to respond to user questions with a personal touch.

Alibaba Group Holding, owner of the South China Morning Post, featured an online shop for digital products based on Baidu’s virtual assistant Duxiaoxiao during the e-commerce giant’s Singles’ Day campaign last year.

  • get through - 完成，达到。

    原文例句：TikTok Shop is also seeking to take on Shein and Temu. TikTok sees international e-commerce expansion so important to its future that it bought a 75 per cent stake in Indonesia’s largest online shopping platform, enabling the firm restart its local operations which had earlier been suspended by regulators in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由get（得到）和through（穿过）两个单词组成的，表示“完成，达到”。在这个例句中，它指的是TikTok Shop正在寻求与Shein和Temu竞争，TikTok认为国际电子商务对其未来的发展非常重要，以至于它收购了印度尼西亚最大的在线购物平台75%的股份，使该公司能够重新启动其当地业务，此前该业务曾被东南亚最大经济体的监管机构暂停。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个复合句，主句是While TikTok remains best known outside China as a platform to consume bite-sized videos，其中主语是TikTok，谓语是remains best known，宾语是as a platform to consume bite-sized videos。live-streaming e-commerce is already big business for the app’s Chinese version, Douyin是一个非限制性定语从句，修饰主句的主语TikTok，表示TikTok的中国版本Douyin的电子商务直播已经是一项大生意。这个句子的意思是说，虽然TikTok在海外最出名的是以平台的形式播放小视频，但对于它的中国版本Douyin来说，电子商务直播已经是一项大生意。

  • The vast majority of companies on Alibaba.com are Chinese, which typically offer big cost advantages owing to the mainland’s vast manufacturing supply chain. - 阿里巴巴国际站上的绝大多数公司都是中国公司，由于中国大陆巨大的制造业供应链，他们通常具有巨大的成本优势。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个简单句，主语是The vast majority of companies on Alibaba.com，谓语是are Chinese，宾语是which typically offer big cost advantages owing to the mainland’s vast manufacturing supply chain。这个句子的意思是说，阿里巴巴国际站上的绝大多数公司都是中国公司，由于中国大陆巨大的制造业供应链，他们通常具有巨大的成本优势。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或行为由主语接受。

    原文例句：While TikTok remains best known outside China as a platform to consume bite-sized videos, live-streaming e-commerce is already big business for the app’s Chinese version, Douyin.

    语法讲解：

    • In its international launch at CES, Alibaba.com’s new AI chatbot showed how it can help buyers with sourcing for merchandise
    • TikTok Shop set up a booth for influencers to sell their wares via live streaming from CES, showing where the platform figures its strengths lie

    Chinese internet giants Alibaba Group Holding and TikTok each put their technological prowess on display last week at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, where their respective artificial intelligence (AI) and live-streaming e-commerce products set the tone for how they plan to embed themselves further into daily life in overseas markets.

    Alibaba.com, the international business-to-business wholesale marketplace of South China Morning Post owner Alibaba, launched its Smart Assistant feature at the world’s largest consumer electronics show, with computers set up around the centre of its booth to show how the embedded chatbot can help buyers navigate the sourcing website.

    Smart Assistant is powered by multiple large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar services – including home-grown Tongyi Qianwen, depending on use case, an Alibaba.com representative said.

    “With advances in AI, we are ushering in the next generation of sourcing and empowering small businesses to succeed with our Smart Assistant at their side,” Chris Lu, general manager at Alibaba.com North America, said in a statement last week.

    Alibaba.com’s debut of Smart Assistant showed how ubiquitous AI innovation was at CES this year. No tech giant’s exhibition was complete without showing off its effort in that space.

    By putting generative AI at the centre of its exhibition, Alibaba.com made it clear where it thought the platform’s advantage lies, despite some grumblings from a marketing manager that the product was not quite yet ready for prime time, according to a brand ambassador at the booth.

    A number of CES attendees at the Alibaba.com presentation were made up of select “gold suppliers”, or those that pay for a premium membership on the platform, according to some exhibitors.

    A test of Smart Assistant by the Post showed the all-too-common limitations of new LLM-powered chatbots. When asked about the best options for sourcing a 10,000-milliampere-hour power bank, it offered a link to search results for the product on Alibaba.com. A follow-up query on the best way to determine differences in quality among suppliers resulted in a generic response about checking certifications and standards.

    ByteDance-owned TikTok, already famous for its more traditional recommendation algorithms that have made its short video service so difficult to put down, went in a different direction at CES. Its TikTok Shop booth inside the Aria Resort & Casino in Las Vegas, was set up with a live-streaming area where some influencers were invited to sell their wares directly from the trade show.

    While TikTok remains best known outside China as a platform to consume bite-sized videos, live-streaming e-commerce is already big business for the app’s Chinese version, Douyin. E-commerce is seen by Beijing-based parent ByteDance as an important area for future growth.

    TikTok Shop representatives were roaming the CES floor looking for companies they can convince to sell on the platform. That task may have been harder for the US team. A US-based TikTok Shop employee told Shenzhen-based mechanical keyboard maker Keychron that he was not allowed to sign up Chinese companies. Only their team in mainland China can on-board those suppliers.

    Connections with mainland Chinese suppliers are seen as the secret weapon for new e-commerce entrants like Shein and PDD Holdings’ Temu. These platforms are taking on Amazon.com on its home turf with dirt-cheap products, which are sold as they roll off the factory floor from their mainland suppliers.

    Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

    “Temu or Shein can get those very low-cost items and low-cost shipping because they have the volume,” said Stanley Wong, co-founder and chief product officer of Hong Kong-based Spaceship, which exhibited at CES under its Taiwanese entity. “They have very professional teams to do that kind of supply chain management.”

    TikTok Shop is also seeking to take on Shein and Temu. TikTok sees international e-commerce expansion so important to its future that it bought a 75 per cent stake in Indonesia’s largest online shopping platform, enabling the firm restart its local operations which had earlier been suspended by regulators in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.

    Chinese suppliers are also Alibaba.com’s bread and butter. While it is ostensibly a global sourcing platform, the vast majority of companies on Alibaba.com are Chinese, which typically offer big cost advantages owing to the mainland’s vast manufacturing supply chain.

    Even start-ups are trying to use AI to help companies navigate the changing landscape of e-commerce in the West. Spaceship, for example, uses AI to help brands manage their own shops with Canadian e-commerce firm Shopify to determine the best logistics options for goods manufactured in China.

    Alibaba pushes new AI tool to help wholesale merchants manage overseas clients

    “Our focus is to enable individual sellers to” achieve cost-effective supply chain management like Shein and Temu, Spaceship’s Wong said.

    As more merchants try to control their own brands and reduce the money they lose to platforms like Shein, Temu and TikTok Shop by operating their own sites, services like Spaceship make sense when making price comparisons on logistics solutions.

    Still, Spaceship does not have its own generative AI product yet to take on the likes of Alibaba. The company said it is considering one for customer service.

    Many of the underpinnings of AI LLMs are open-source code, making the technology easily accessible to start-ups even if they do not have the data advantage of tech giants. But it could be some time before the kinks are worked out and these start-ups can handle more sophisticated requirements of business users.

item.title: CES 2024: Hong Kong start-ups attract interest from Microsoft, Best Buy amid overseas push
item.description:
Summary：

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella visited the booth of Hong Kong start-up AI Guided at CES 2024, showing interest in its AI-powered belt for guiding the blind. The Hong Kong pavilion attracted much attention this year, with a record number of 20 Hong Kong-based companies exhibiting and receiving interest from retailers and potential partners. The city's efforts to transform into a tech hub are yielding results, with start-ups like AI Guided showcasing innovative products and seeking global expansion.
  • Abstract: Hong Kong start-ups shine at CES 2024, gaining attention from tech giants and seeking global expansion.
  • Theme: Hong Kong's growing tech hub and the success of its start-ups at CES 2024.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of innovation, collaboration, and global exposure for start-ups; the potential of Hong Kong as a tech hub.
  • Main information: Microsoft CEO's visit to AI Guided's booth; increased participation of Hong Kong start-ups at CES; the focus on companies ready for market deals; interest from Best Buy in Invisible Tech's furniture with embedded speakers; Sitan Semiconductor and Raysolve Technology showcasing micro-LED displays.

总结：

微软首席执行官萨提亚·纳德拉在2024年国际消费类电子产品展览会（CES）上参观了香港展馆的一家初创公司AI Guided的展位，对该公司研发的AI动力腰带表现出浓厚兴趣，该腰带可帮助盲人进行路径引导。今年，香港展馆吸引了众多关注，创纪录地有20家香港初创公司参展，并受到了零售商和其他潜在合作伙伴的关注。香港将自身转型为科技中心的努力正在取得成果，像AI Guided这样的初创公司展示了创新产品并寻求全球扩张。
  • 摘要：香港初创企业在2024年CES大会上大放异彩，吸引了科技巨头和全球市场的目光。
  • 主题：香港日益发展壮大的科技中心以及其初创企业在2024年CES大会上的成功。
  • 观点：对于初创企业而言，创新、协作和全球曝光的重要性；香港作为科技中心的发展潜力。
  • 主要信息：微软首席执行官访问了AI Guided的展位；香港初创企业参加CES大会的人数增加；重点关注准备进行市场交易的公司；百思买公司对Invisible Tech生产的带有嵌入式扬声器的家具表现出兴趣；Sitan Semiconductor和Raysolve Technology展示了微型LED显示屏。

单词：

  • booth (n.) - /buːθ/ 小屋，摊位。

    原文例句：Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella stopped by the booth of a start-up at the Hong Kong pavilion that makes an AI-powered belt to guide blind people.

    例句讲解：“booth”意为“小屋，摊位”，是一个较小的临时建筑，通常用于展销商品或提供服务，也可以泛指展览会或集市中的摊位。

  • pavilion (n.) - /pəˈvɪljən/ 展馆，亭子。

    原文例句：Last Tuesday, the first day of the trade show in Las Vegas, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella swung by the Tech Hong Kong pavilion to chat with AI Guided, a company that makes a belt with haptic feedback for obstacle detection, helping to guide the blind.

    例句讲解：“pavilion”意为“展馆，亭子”，是为举办展览或博览会而建造的临时性建筑，通常具有较大的空间和开放式设计。

  • haptic (adj.) - /ˈhæptɪk/ 触觉的，触觉反馈的。

    原文例句：The company makes a belt with haptic feedback for obstacle detection, helping to guide the blind.

    例句讲解：“haptic”意为“触觉的，触觉反馈的”，是指通过触觉提供信息或反馈，例如手机震动或游戏手柄的振动提示。

词组：

  • ready to sell - 准备出售，可以出售的。

    原文例句：“We had to make some selection of companies that have more of a mature level of readiness in terms of being ready to sell,” Yiu said in an interview.

    例句讲解：“ready to sell”意为“准备出售，可以出售的”，强调商品或产品已准备就绪，可以进行销售。

  • get new business - 获得新业务，拓展新业务。

    原文例句：“We really mean to help them get new business.”

    例句讲解：“get new business”意为“获得新业务，拓展新业务”，是指企业或个人通过各种途径获得新的客户或业务合同。

句子：

  • The Hong Kong pavilion at this year’s CES, which concluded on Friday, featured a variety of start-ups that make products ranging from the quirky to the practical. - 在今年的CES展会上，香港馆汇集了各种初创企业，他们的产品从新奇到实用，不一而足。

    句子分析：这是一个主谓宾结构的句子，主语是The Hong Kong pavilion at this year’s CES, which concluded on Friday，谓语是featured，宾语是a variety of start-ups that make products ranging from the quirky to the practical。其中，which concluded on Friday是一个非限定性定语从句，修饰先行词The Hong Kong pavilion，表示香港馆在星期五闭幕。make products ranging from the quirky to the practical是一个现在分词短语作定语，修饰先行词start-ups，表示初创企业生产的产品从新奇到实用，范围很广。这个句子的意思是说，在今年的CES展会上，香港馆汇集了各种初创企业，他们的产品从新奇到实用，不一而足。

语法：

  • 动词不定式作宾语 - 动词不定式可以作宾语，表示动作或状态。

    原文例句：Invisible Tech also uses recycled materials in some parts of its products.

    语法讲解：动词不定式作宾语，表示动作或状态。在这个例句中，动词不定式作宾语，表示Invisible Tech在一些产品的部分中使用了再生材料。

    • Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella stopped by the booth of a start-up at the Hong Kong pavilion that makes an AI-powered belt to guide blind people
    • Other start-ups say they have received interest at the show from retailers and other potential partners as Hong Kong firms look overseas

    Microsoft and Best Buy expressed interest in Hong Kong start-ups at CES 2024, after the city’s pavilion at the world’s largest consumer electronics show saw the most interest there in years.

    Last Tuesday, the first day of the trade show in Las Vegas, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella swung by the Tech Hong Kong pavilion to chat with AI Guided, a company that makes a belt with haptic feedback for obstacle detection, helping to guide the blind.

    “Microsoft really supports accessibility technology,” said Steve Kong, co-founder and chief technology officer of AI Guided. “The dream of our company is that in three to five years … visually impaired people can have some hands-free experience to navigate the world.”

    AI Guided is one of 20 Hong Kong-based companies exhibiting with the city’s start-up pavilion this year, a big improvement over the eight that exhibited last year because of the last-minute lifting of Covid-19 restrictions.

    Even leading up to the show, Hong Kong Science and Technology Park (HKSTP) said 40 companies applied to exhibit in the Eureka Park start-up area, a marked improvement over previous years, according to H L Yiu, corporate development officer for HKSTP, which runs the pavilion.

    Realme unveils 12 Pro series smartphone in parallel event to CES

    “We had to make some selection of companies that have more of a mature level of readiness in terms of being ready to sell,” Yiu said in an interview. “We really mean to help them get new business.”

    With limited space, HKSTP focused on picking companies that were closer to having products ready to go, or even already in the market, with the goal of picking up business deals at CES.

    For some, that could pan out in a big way.

    Invisible & Innovation Technology, aka Invisible Tech, which builds speakers into furniture, said it has received interest from Best Buy. A representative from the largest electronics retail chain in the US told Invisible Tech that it had not seen other products like its cabinet with an embedded speaker in the base, according to the start-up’s co-founder Patrick Lee.

    “Best Buy always wants to source something new,” said Lee. “Furniture is a very traditional thing that [has not had] much disruptive design or link with technology.”

    Invisible Tech also uses recycled materials in some parts of its products. Henry Cheung, the company’s other co-founder, said the company wants to “help Hong Kong fulfil its carbon neutral mission”. The city aims to be carbon neutral by 2050.

    The Hong Kong pavilion at this year’s CES, which concluded on Friday, featured a variety of start-ups that make products ranging from the quirky to the practical.

    XOXO Beverages already has its cocktail-making machine in about 10 bars and restaurants in Hong Kong, but it has not expanded to home use yet. Co-founder Peter Yau said CES was the best show the company has been to.

    “People from all around the world come by and are very interested in the product,” Yau said. “[We got] a lot of contacts, and we’re looking to see what we can do after [the show] with those guys.”

    Two of the participating companies, Sitan Semiconductor International and Raysolve Technology, make micro-LED displays, something that has become more important amid rising interest in augmented reality glasses.

    Sitan was started at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and the company said its tech has already found its way into products from big brands like TCL, Huawei Technologies, Oppo and Meizu – although not all of these products have been released.

    For most of the start-ups, though, CES was about getting leads and looking for ways to expand beyond their home market. Getting the attention of a tech giant like Microsoft is one way to achieve that.

    Asked about the prospects of Microsoft investing, AI Guided’s Kong said, “I hope so … I will still have another discussion with them, so we’ll see.”

    This kind of attention also may help the Hong Kong government justify its efforts to turn the city into a tech hub, which has had mixed results in a city better known as a regional financial hub.

    “From a tech area standpoint, I think the opportunity to come to Hong Kong is surging,” said HKSTP’s Yiu. “The number of start-ups that we nurture every year is an increasing trend.”
